dt.t: {wi}whole{/wi} of an ancient evil, I sleep sound

dt: {bc}physically sound and healthy {bc}free of disease or deformity
{bc}having all its proper parts or components {bc}{sx|complete||}, {sx|unmodified||}
{bc}constituting the total sum or undiminished entirety {bc}{sx|entire||}

dt.t: took part in the {wi}whole{/wi} series of athletic events
the {wi}whole{/wi} idea is to help, not hinder

dt: {bc}very great in quantity, extent, or scope
{bc}constituting the entirety of a person's nature or development

pt: {sc}perfect{/sc} {sc}whole{/sc} {sc}entire{/sc} {sc}intact{/sc} mean not lacking or faulty in any particular. {sc}perfect{/sc} implies the soundness and the excellence of every part, element, or quality of a thing frequently as an unattainable or theoretical state.
{sc}whole{/sc} suggests a completeness or perfection that can be sought, gained, or regained.

pt.t: felt like a {it}whole{/it} person again after vacation

pt: {sc}entire{/sc} implies perfection deriving from integrity, soundness, or completeness of a thing.
{sc}intact{/sc} implies retention of perfection of a thing in its natural or original state.

et: Middle English {it}hool{/it} healthy, unhurt, entire, from Old English {it}hāl{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}heil{/it} healthy, unhurt, Old Norse {it}heill{/it}, Old Church Slavonic {it}cělŭ{/it}
shortdef: free of wound or injury : unhurt
recovered from a wound or injury : restored

dt: {bc}a complete amount or sum {bc}a number, aggregate, or totality lacking no part, member, or element
{bc}something constituting a complex unity {bc}a coherent system or organization of parts fitting or working together as one
usually used in the phrase {it}in whole or in part{/it}
{bc}in view of all the circumstances or conditions {bc}all things considered

shortdef: a complete amount or sum : a number, aggregate, or totality lacking no part, member, or element
something constituting a complex unity : a coherent system or organization of parts fitting or working together as one

dt: usually used in the phrase {it}out of whole cloth{/it}

dt.t: the theory was created out of {it}whole cloth{/it}

shortdef: pure fabrication —usually used in the phrase out of whole cloth

dt: {bc}a natural food and especially an unprocessed one (such as a vegetable or fruit)

shortdef: a natural food and especially an unprocessed one (such as a vegetable or fruit)

dt: {bc}wind having a speed of 55 to 63 miles (88 to 102 kilometers) per hour {dx}see {dxt|Beaufort Scale Table|beaufort scale|table}{/dx}

shortdef: wind having a speed of 55 to 63 miles (88 to 102 kilometers) per hour

dt: usually used adverbially in the phrase {it}go the whole hog{/it}

shortdef: the whole way or farthest limit —usually used adverbially in the phrase go the whole hog

dt.t: accepting {it}whole hog{/it} the standards … of the majority

shortdef: to the fullest extent : without reservation : completely

dt: {bc}a method of teaching reading and writing that emphasizes learning whole words and phrases by encountering them in meaningful contexts rather than by phonics exercises

shortdef: a method of teaching reading and writing that emphasizes learning whole words and phrases by encountering them in meaningful contexts rather than by phonics exercises
